Definition.WordDefinition:
Pleasantry \Pleas"ant*ry\, n.; pl. {Pleasantries}. [F. plaisanterie. See {Pleasant}.] That which denotes or promotes pleasure or good humor; cheerfulness; gayety; merriment; especially, an agreeable playfulness in conversation; a jocose or humorous remark; badinage. [1913 Webster]
The grave abound in pleasantries, the dull in repartees and points of wit. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
The keen observation and ironical pleasantry of a finished man of the world. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
